content:
Not sure how useful that can be, but.

When I scan for unprioritized issues in /alerts I often get confused because a new message pushes the topic up to the top and mixup the order I am scanning topics for unprioritized issues. I'd like to mark these topics as "unread/unresolved" until prioritized and quickly see the "todo" issue list that needs prioritization for this week.

Apparently I cannot yet mark a topic as "todo", but one workaround I've been suggested is to star a message and have it grouped at the top left of view (on the browser)
it's okay i often scan for unprioritised issues once a day or so, so if you miss something there's a chance someone else from the group will pick it
@apiraino :+1: if it works for you go ahead and do that
seems like a good workaround :), but yeah I've more or less the same issue and I just scan for the unprioritized ones
the ability to tag a topic as resolved and unresolved would be nice for these kind of cases
yeah we had once discussed renaming the threads to something like [resolved] once the prioritisation has been removed
also forgetting issues means we get more feedback :grinning:
